intro: Schistocarpha pseudoseleri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thistle, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped, often with serrated edges, and its flowers are yellow, forming dense clusters at the top of the plant. Schistocarpha pseudoseleri is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
